title: Add Internet Identity sign-in UI to Jungle Fury game

requirements.text: Add an Internet Identity authentication UI to the Jungle Fury game so a user can explicitly sign in and sign out from within the app.
acceptanceCriteria: The HUD includes a clearly labeled "Sign in" button when the user is anonymous.
Clicking "Sign in" calls the existing `useInternetIdentity().login()` flow (no custom auth implementation).
When the user is signed in, the HUD shows a "Sign out" button that calls `useInternetIdentity().clear()`.
The HUD shows a basic signed-in indicator (e.g., "Signed in" and the principal string or a shortened principal) when authenticated.
Authentication errors (from `loginStatus === "loginError"`) are displayed in the UI in English and are non-blocking to the rest of the app.

requirements.text: Ensure all user-facing HUD text is in English and remove emoji characters from the main title text.

quotes: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: The main game title renders as plain English text without emoji characters.
All newly added authentication UI labels and messages are in English.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all backend logic in the single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo); do not introduce additional backend services.
Do not route or serve images through the backend; keep using static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated.
nonGoals: Generate an Android APK/AAB or any Play Store publishing artifacts.
Implement any non-Internet-Identity third-party authentication provider.
Add new gameplay mechanics unrelated to authentication UI.
